intro: Centaurea attica, commonly known as Attic centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Centaurea attica is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
